review.title: Opinion Mining and Analysis: A survey
review.abstract: The current research is focusing on the area of Opinion Mining also called as sentiment analysis due to sheer volume of opinion rich web resources such as discussion forums, review sites and blogs are available in digital form. One important problem in sentiment analysis of product reviews is to produce summary of opinions based on product features. We have surveyed and analyzed in this paper, various techniques that have been developed for the key tasks of opinion mining. We have provided an overall picture of what is involved in developing a software system for opinion mining on the basis of our survey and analysis.

sections.text: DOI: 10.5121 / ijnlc.2013.2304 39Current research focuses on the area of opinion mining, which is also known as sentiment analysis due to the sheer volume of opinion-rich web resources such as discussion forums, review platforms and blogs. An important problem with sentiment analysis of product ratings is the summary of opinions based on product characteristics. In this paper, we have examined and analyzed various techniques developed for the key tasks of opinion mining. We have provided an overall picture of the development of an opinion mining software system based on our survey and analyses. KEYWORDSOpinion Mining, Sentiment Analysis, Product Reviews, Machine Learning

sections.text: A very popular communication tool among Internet users is microblogging. Millions of messages appear daily on popular microblogging sites such as Twitter, Tumblr, Facebook. Twitter messages sometimes express opinions that are used as a data source for classifying feelings. [4]

sections.heading: 3. SENTIMENT CLASSIFICATION
sections.text: One method for analyzing subjective information in a large number of texts and many studies is sentiment classification. A typical approach to sentiment classification is the use of machine learning.

sections.heading: 3.1. Machine Learning
sections.text: A system that is able to automatically acquire and integrate knowledge is called machine learning. Systems that learn from analytical observation, training, experience and other means result in a system that can exhibit self-improvement, effectiveness and efficiency. Knowledge and a corresponding knowledge organization are normally used by a machine learning system to test, interpret and analyze the acquired knowledge. One of the machine learning algorithms is the taxonomy, which is based on the outcome of the algorithm or the type of input available. • Supervised learning generates a function that maps inputs to desired outputs, also known as labels, because they are training examples described by human experts. As it is a text classification problem, any supervised learning method can be applied, e.g. Naïve Bayes classification, and supports vector machines • Unsupervised learning models include a range of inputs, such as clustering, that are not known during training.

sections.heading: 3.2. Sentiment Analysis Tasks
sections.text: The tasks of sentiment analysis consist mainly in classifying the polarity of a given text at the document, sentence or feature / aspect level, which expresses the opinion as positive, negative or neutral. sections.heading: 7. TOOLS
sections.text: A red opal is a tool that allows users to find products based on characteristics. Customer reviews are used to rate each product. Opinions on the Web are analyzed and compared with Opinion Observer. Product reviews are presented feature by feature in chart format. Aggregation pages are automated by Review Seer Tool. Extracted features are assigned positive and negative ratings by Naïve Bayes Classifier. Searched pages are not properly classified by this tool, resulting in attributes and their score. Product features are heuristically extracted in Web Fountain by means of a defined Base Noun Phrase (bBNP). Sentimental lexicon and Sentiment Pattern Database are used to identify sensation patterns. Sentiment patterns are defined in the Sentiment Pattern Database and polarity of terms is defined in Sentimentlex1.

sections.heading: 8. CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: The challenge in sentiment analysis of product ratings is to create a summary of opinions based on product features / attributes (also called aspects). Humans can express features with many different words or phrases. These words and phrases are grouped under the same set of features to create a useful summary. Limited work has been done on grouping synonyms and clustering. In the future, Opinion Mining can be performed on a set of reviews and a set of discovered feature expressions extracted from ratings.
